Test.details: This is a test and I hope it works test.

arthritis.details: Put on that cozy winter gear and try playing a browser-based game.

blindness.prompt: Close your eyes and use a screen reader
blindness.details: Use either NVDA for Windows or VoiceOver for Mac to operate your computer.

cataracts.details: Use this operating system setting on Mac or Windows to enable a special theme.

color-blindness-blocked-visual-field.details: Add this low vision simulator extension to Google Chrome. Turn it on before using the web.
color-blindness-blocked-visual-field.condition: color blindness or a blocked visual field

contrast-loss.details: See how your company’s website looks on a cheap projector.

diminished-problem-solving-skills.details: Set an alarm for 2:45 AM and immediately try to book a flight for that vacation you’ve been dreaming about.

dyslexia.details: Add this Dyslexia simulator bookmarklet to your web browser. Turn it on before reading a news article.

english-as-a-second-language.prompt: Run your documents through a translator
english-as-a-second-language.details: Google offers a service to help with this. The lack of accuracy is the point!

glare.details: Use either your monitor’s settings, or do this through your operating system (Mac or Windows).

glaucoma.details: Use an operating system setting on Mac or a program on Windows to show a magnified version of your screen.

hearing-loss.prompt: Go to a loud coffee shop
hearing-loss.details: Try and have a quiet conversation with a friend. A popular bar could also suffice.

limb-loss.details: You'll have to rely on your non-dominant hand.

low-bandwidth.details: Use the Network tab in Google Chrome’s Developer Tools to throttle your network connection.

multiple-sclerosis.details: Try a full body workout, then try and prepare dinner from scratch. Remember to stretch and hydrate!

nearsightedness.details: Resize the text on your browser to make it very small. Type Ctrl− on Windows or Cmd− on Mac until the text stops shrinking.

nearsightedness-farsightedness.details: The prescription strength doesn’t matter. If you wear glasses already, take them off.

neural-hearing-loss.details: Then try and watch a documentary.

oral-learning-disability.details: Familiarize yourself with the rules, then exclusively use it to communicate.

parkinsons-disease.details: Navigate your computer using the keyboard. Using the trackpad is cheating!

quadriplegia.prompt: Hold a Sharpie with your mouth
quadriplegia.details: Keep your hands behind your back and try to use your computer with the improvised mouth stick.

tinnitus.details: Put on some earbuds and play this video. Then try and have a conversation with a coworker.

traumatic-brain-injury.details: These series of exercises demonstrate the different ways aphasia can manifest.

vertigo.details: Once you’ve gotten dizzy, try solving a crossword puzzle on your smartphone.
